column4: Hello, I'm having a little problem with running 32-bit executables on 64-bit ubuntu... my teacher has compiled a 32-bit c++ executable and I can't run it.  Isn't there backward compatability with the 64-bit OS? Do I have to do something "special" to get it running?

Hello everybody... I need a little help: I'm having a problem with running 32-bit executables on 64-bit ubuntu... my teacher has compiled a 32-bit c++ executable and I can't run it.  Isn't there backward compatability with the 64-bit OS? Do I have to do something "special" to get it running?
what is it then a bin file?
well what are you try to run - what is the file extension?
there is no file extention, but when I type 'file referee' (referee is the name of the file) it gives me the following info: " ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel... blah blah"
yeah that just says 32 bit - dunno can't help any further sorry --
I think usser_: was going in the right direction.. I will just look for ia32 package in
yes the will install the 32 bit libs
but a force-archetecture can destroy your system if not careful
I think that's the definiation of shite
I'm telling you, I'm pulling whatever is left out of my hair now...
let me see what I can find about 32 bit libs hang on
thanks, let me do it right now
OK, ia32-libs works like a charm! THANK YOU!
owe me a coffee!  glad to help!
